title: IBM Cloud Schematics docs
introduction: Explore the capabilities of IBM Cloud Schematics. You can get started with deploying platform services by using Schematics Workspaces, and automating cloud operations with Schematics actions. Learn more about how Schematics works and the benefits of using the service.

links.title: Automate cloud operations with actions
links.description: Learn how to automatically start and stop a Virtual Servers for VPC instance with an IBM-provided Ansible playbook.

links.title: Extend provisioning through agents
links.description: Learn how to provision, configure, and operate your private or on-premises cloud cluster resources without any time, network, or software restrictions.

links.title: Deploy cloud services with workspaces
links.description: Use an IBM-provided Terraform template to create an Object Storage service instance to store your data in IBM Cloud.

links.title: Explore the IBM Cloud software catalog
links.description: Try out one of the IBM-provided software templates to quickly spin up a classic virtual server instance (VSI), and automatically configure the instance to connect to an IBM Cloud Database.

links.title: Learn more about Schematics
links.description: Learn about how Schematics works, integrated open source technologies, and the benefits of using the service.

links.title: Browse Terraform templates
links.description: Explore the sample Terraform templates, onboard them to your private catalogs, and try them using Schematics.

links.title: Set up the Schematics CLI
links.description: Install the Schematics CLI plug-in to perform Schematics actions in your IBM Cloud account.
